body:
This is my first ever blog. I am writing this blog after reading a post on Dev.to which listed the various benefits of writing blogs. So, instead of writing i got down to making a blog and what is a better first blog than the making of the blog itself, hence the title: Blog about this blog
Okay, so it was 1 am in night, 19th April 2020 my birthday , but due to corona virus outbreak couldn't celebrate so was browsing posts on dev.to. Seeing people write blogs kind of inspired me when i found a blog about why to write blogs and that's where it began. 2 a.m. at night i had the idea of making a blog app from scratch, with something i have never used(frontend, i suck at designing ðŸ˜…). So i picked up materialize and started reading the docs. one hour later i have a static website with first page which if fully responsive and will list all the blogs.

Selecting tech stack

  • 1.)Materialize
  • 2.)Node.js
  • 3.)express

There is not a particular reason i went with materialize, it just feels minimalistic and smoother than other frameworks out there like Bootstrap. Nodejs and express are something that i recently learnt and am trying to master, i am working on one more project using node and express and my experience is pretty good so far. Let's Begin So the first thing i needed was some cool looking UI, materialize was pretty easy and straightforward in getting this done. I used grid layout with 0-12-0 columns on small and 2-8-2 on medium and above devices. For now the 8 column is the main holder of the blog list and for the 2 columns in left and right i have something in mind. 
<div class="row">
   <div class="col s0 m2"></div>
   <div class="col s12 m8"></div>
   <div class="col s0 m2"></div>
</div>
title: Blog about this blog
